meanings.definition: The measurement of altitude or elevation above sea level.
meanings.sent1: Altimetry helps us understand how high something is above the sea.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use altimetry to determine the height of mountains.
meanings.sent3: During the hiking trip, the altimetry device comically showed our altitude as 'sky high' when we were just on a hill.
meanings.sent4: Her progress in life was like an altimetry chart, always reaching new heights.
meanings.sent5: The altimetry reading on the plane's screen made the view from above even more breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The science or technique of measuring altitudes.
meanings.sent1: Understanding altimetry is important for pilots to navigate safely.
meanings.sent2: Altimetry involves using specialized tools to calculate heights accurately.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he was so bad at altimetry, he once thought a hill was a mountain.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, success was a journey through the challenging terrain of altimetry.
meanings.sent5: The altimetry equipment beeped softly as it recorded the changing altitude during the flight.
